38980281.review:
Не шедевр, но вещь отличная.
Игра очень приятная. Хороший закос под 8 бит, музыка нравится, отзывчевое управление, правильные хитбоксы.
Не сложая, часа за 3-4 можно пройти вдоль и поперёк на все достижения, застопорившись всего на двух трёх уровнях.
Красивый дизайн боссов, но они, к сожалению, слишком просты.
Вобще игре не хватает уровня сложности Хард, где герою было бы 2-3 попадания на жизнь.
Да и игра слишком простая по своему построению, ни особых паверапов, ни особых движений персонажа (отскок от стен, дэш и подобное)

К сожалению, есть баги:
- Зачастую, после паузы в игре, пропадает анимация объектов, а некоторые вещи могут и вовсе замереть на месте, например огонь из пропастей, при том он продолжает дамажить.
- Так же, после паузы, может пропасть информация в HUD. То есть, таймер, колличество патронов, очков и жизней и здоровья показывают 0, хотя на деле всё на месте.
- Не корректно работает внутриигровое отображение достижений, и это плохо! Я прошёл все уровни, кроме одного, без смертей. Игра показывает, что я не прошёл 5 уровень. Я давай его перепроходить, но достижение не засчитывается! А в Стим я увидел, что у меня нет аччивки на прохождение 6 уровня без смерти! Я прошёл 6 уровень и достижение на 5 уровень в игре засчиталось. А ведь за эти аччивки открываются 2 бонусных режима.
- Есть 2 бонусных режима. Один открывается после прохождения всех уровней. Второй режим открывается после прохождения всех уровней без смертей. И это не работает! Я прошёл все уровни, у меня появилось название первого режима на кнопке, то есть режим открылся, но я не мог его запуcтить. Я смог его запустить, только когда открыл второй бонусный режим, который я не мог открыть, потому что игра не корректно отобразила достижения. Вот так.

Вобщем баги есть и они очень заметны. Однако, всё равно это всё фигня и это всё преодолевается, игра хороша. Отсылок не много.
8 бит из 8ми!

38980256.review: Совершенно ломовейший клон Contra (8bit). на 2-3 часа займет совершенно точно, 6 уровень - классически адово сложный. За такую смешную цену однозначно МАТХЭВ!

38784110.review:
[h1]この顔にビビっときたら [/h1] 

このゲームの主人公は『ガンデック』というファミコンのゲームの主人公とクリソツです。
下水道や列車などのドット絵も『ガンデック』にとても似ています。
『ガンデック』が好きだったので衝動的に買ってしまいました。
ゲームデザインはシューティングアクションであり、ソード主体の『ガンデック』とはだいぶ異なります。
忍者龍剣伝、ロックマン、魂斗羅などを思わせるギミックもあります。
難易度は全体的に低めで、気軽に遊べます（ただしステージ6だけはちょっと難しい）。
値段も安いですしファミコンっぽい雰囲気に浸りたいなら悪くないです。
なぜかキーコンフィングが記憶されない、ボスが弱すぎる点は少々残念なところ。

◇攻略メモ
・特殊武器
[spoiler]特殊武器には弾数があり、かつ弾倉アイテムは特殊武器を持っている状態でないと取得できないので、なるべく武器を使い果たさないようにするとよいでしょう。初期武器は弱いです。
弾倉あるいは同種武器を重ねどりしていくことによって弾数を大量に増やすことができます。
そのためには、一に無駄撃ちを控え、二に取る武器を厳選することです。
個人的には丸いやつが挙動が素直で配置も多く使いやすいと感じました。[/spoiler] 

・即死対策
[spoiler]体力が多めなので、わざとダメージを受けて無敵時間で突っ切るテクニックも有効です。
特に突き落としを狙ってくる場所では割り切って最初からくらい抜けで行くのも手です。残機は大切にね。[/spoiler] 

・ステージ6
[spoiler]最大の難所になるであろう、ステージ6のシャッター地帯（ロ〇クマン２のク〇ックマンのあれ）では、ポーズを使って次の穴を確認すると抜けやすくなるかも。幸いにして本家のようなインチキ防止機能はないです。[/spoiler]

36121978.review:
Alien Splatter Redux is an excellent homage to 8-bit classics from the 1980s, such as Ninja Gaiden or Contra. The gameplay itself is nothing new to the genre, you're sidescrolling, shooting, and jumping over death pits while evading enemy shots and picking up an assortment of powerups which alter the pattern of your primary gunfire. This includes the traditional spreadshot, a fast-moving laser shot, a boomerang type shot (think Castlevania's cross subitem..) and others. You also pickup ammo for these various shot types, however you can only carry one gun at a time and it seems if you pickup another new gun type it will drop your ammo count down to the original 32 rather than transfer your accumulated ammo over, which can be a little bit annoying. You get so many of them so often though that it's never much of a hindrance. Some of the powerups seem a bit OP when compared to others though, such as the aforementioned boomerang which seems to slay bosses (including 2 instances where the sprite for one of its shots looked like it got hooked / glitched out on the stomach of the boss of stage 3...) while others, such as the linear (but fast) laser shot and the piddly little "flamethrower" seem to be more ineffective, requiring you to be positioned too accurately by comparison. 


The game itself isn't quite as hardcore difficult as the titles of yesteryear, in that health pickups are scattered around the levels generously, and if you do die from falling down a pit you often restart at a checkpoint nearby rather than restarting the entire level (if you die at a boss, for example, you restart at the boss itself -minus your weapon modification/ammo- you do have a limited number of lives, however...) 


The enemy patterns or dangers throughout the level aren't overly difficult to navigate either, whether it be arcs of lightning from certain platforms or weird fish enemies jumping up from the water to knock you down into the depths, the speed or quantity of their attacks never require too much precision to get around and don't occupy a large area of the screen. The enemies could be a little more varied, as you often see the same types throughout each of the levels, however this is also reminiscent of retro games in that they often repeated use of the same sprites as well.

Ability-wise the game is more akin to early 8 bit titles, you are relegated to running, jumping, and shooting. You have no slide, double-jump, or wall-clinging/sliding abilities. There is no leveling up your weapons or character, so the game is very straight-forward. The game progresses in a "level-by-level" manner, so there is not much exploration at all, instead consisting mostly of "running to the right" until you reach the end level boss, defeat them, and move on to the next location. 

All-in-all there isn't much to say about Alien Splatter Redux. If you're looking for a well-made, retro, 8-bit style game this is one of the best (and most affordable) available on Steam. Its music, sound effects, graphics, level design, and difficulty are all well done and in line with what made games of that era so endearing, and I look forward to playing more.

36066078.review: Jogo muito bom, relembrando os clássicos de 8 bit

35214772.review:
If your like me, and you enjoy hard, challenging, fun 8 bit games, then this is for you. Controls are responsive, the weapon variety is limited, but fun to experiment with. I havent finished it yet, but its truly enjoyable to play. If you came for challenge, challenge is what you'll get.

However, like mentioned, the game has quite a small weapon variety compared to the mechanics you could have to pair with the amazing level design. At time, an weapon that would fire on a circular pattern would help, or a weapon that would leave a delayed explosive so you could arrange for kills without putting yourself at risk. Sure, this would break the point of the game being challenge, but this comment is mostly for making an example of how more weapons could compliment the level designs perfectly. 
Similar to weapons, the enemy variety is mostly prominent on bosses, to the point where the only threat you'll have during stages are going to be stage hazards more than enemies. After a while you just get their attack patterns down and they become more an obstacle than a challenging foe you have to beat to progress. 

For as much as I like this game, and im willing to 100% it for fun, I'll have to say yes, but not a 10/10. The game is great, yes, and I do recommend it, but it just has a lot of missed opportunities to make it outstanding.
This game truly has the potential to become a mindblowing adventure, but it just falls short by a small margin.

7/10, great game overall, lacking some mechanics and more enemy diversity, amazing nontheless.

34598695.review: Suprisingly fun, this game is superior to the original free version that was included with Sinclair Strange's previously completed titled (emphasis on completed): Jet Gunner. When Jet Gunner was released, an early version of Alien Splatter was given out with it as a free bonus. While that was fun to play around with, it had no controller support and had little replayability. This redux, on the other hand, shows that the developer took the time to flesh out their earlier concept into a fully fledged game. I highly recommend you check this one out if you're into games such as Contra, the original Metal Gear, or Vice: Project Doom (the most appropriate comparison to this game).

34305298.review:
Juego muy entretenido basado en gran parte en aquellos grandes arcades de la consola NES de Nintendo, para mí, la mejor que ha existido nunca por la cantidad de joyas que aparecieron.
Los gráficos cumplen a la perfección en la misión de sumergirnos de lleno en la nostalgia con unos diseños retro que nada tienen que envidiar a los mejores gráficos de la dorada época de los 8-bit.
La banda sonora y los sonidos cumplen también al ser idénticos a los que podíamos encontrarnos en aquellos años.
Un juego muy barato y unas experiencias retro jugables más que satisfactorias.
Lo recomiendo.

33933638.review:
A simple game with retro 8 graphics about two things: platforming and kicking alien ass. The gameplay is simple but fun, with basic platforming and interesting levels, from underground sewers to a moving train being hit by lightning. Most of the weapons feel fun and easy to use, and most enemies are diverse and fun to fight against. Bosses are interesting and are well  put to get, if a little bit bullet spongey.  The games' aesthetic brings back nostagia of Contra and the like, and if you feel like vomiting out your vital organs and/or commiting suicide, you can turn on the retro-vision to empty your eye sockets and fill you with even more nostagia. If I were to have any large complaints, it would be the controls on keyboards, as they are weird and unconventional. The game also don't save your keybinds between instances of the game, meaning you have to rebind them between play sessions. However, this can all be avoided if you just use a controller, which makes it feel better anyway.  My other complaint is that there is quite a large difficult curve between the train and snow stage, with unfair enemy placement, ice physics and that f***ing snow. Other then that, there are some small typos and lack of an options in the setting menu, but that is fine. So to anyone who wants to be entertained for an afternoon or two and who have some spare change in their steam wallets, pick this game up. 

8.5 Pretty Great

33919564.review:
Personal Rating: 6/10 

Alien Splatter Redux is a fun little Contra-inspired shoot-em-up. It boasts both pleasant NES-like graphics, as well as a suitable soundtrack to bolster it further. However though, when you dig a little deeper, you find things aren't as they seem. Here are a few pros and cons I picked up while playing through the game.

+ Awesome NES-like graphics
+ Good music and SFX
+ Tight controls make platforming fun and enjoyable.
+ Enjoyable weapon powerups

- Simplistic level design makes for boring and tedius play.
- Weapon power-ups both overwrite each other, and deplete in ammo reverting you back to your default weapon.
- Some environmental terrain mechanics simply don't make sense, such as running water pushing you away from a waterfull that'd normally suck you closer to it...

Overall, it's a simple game that pays homage to games like Contra; however, it is a dollar for a reason. Know this and expect shortcomings when you play.

33917315.review:
tl;dr: Alien Splatter Redux is an allegorory to artistical consistency and ethics in game development: 'The Ripoff' Guy starts a war against 'Amateur Sh*t' Aliens. It's cheap, ugly, boring and no one wants it.

ASR is simplistic pseudo-retro platformer full of pandering for 'good old days' (namely project vice and contra) which brings nothing of value to the genre. It's a checklist 'retro' game. Faux 8bit, primitive soundtrack, moving platforms, elevators, lasers, pickups, instadeath pits etc.
The issue isn't the fact that it has nothing of it's own (like Axiom Verge or Shovel Knight), but the fact it isn't even good at ripping other games off (like Super Cyborg). If you are that 'retro' to the point of almost copying artwork, just make sure your game is actually any good in comparison.
The main story of the game is that Green Guy goes totally not ripping other games off and kills some Pink Blobs in the process. The same 5 types of pink blobs. Every level. Every small boring and repetitive level (with late ones being ugly too). Music is repetitive and not memorable, it's just a faux 8bit beeps you've seen millions of times. You'll fight the same enemies, jump the same platforms in different tilesets, pickup the same guns. Then there is bosses that look like slightly bigger pink blobs and they sometimes shoot stuff and die. Controls are simple, but a bit glitchy (which is rarely an issue though).

Technically the game runs and supports gamepads.

Well, I think the game could provide a hour of entertainment for a low price if you have no other platformers to play, but you probably do - the genre is pretty healthy these days.

33889837.review: It's pretty fun, looks and sounds like an authentic 8-bit game but it's pretty damn easy. But for the price I'd still recommend for any fans of the good ol' NES

33888109.review:
A nice retro style game with original artwork and music, if you're looking for something that has the style and feel of old NES games without havaing to bother with cables, cartridges, or coaxial cables this is going to be well worth the price. 

Comes complete with chiptune soundtrack, pixel sprites, gameboy style level, guns, aliens, and even the feel of a well aged retro translation.

33886368.review:
It's like a return to the glory days of Contra. While not an obvious hack or reskin, that influence is immediately apparent. Much of what made the classic NES run n' gun titles work is here, even some of the most infuriating aspect like the wind erffects of Ninja Gaiden and the fire dodging pitfalls from Mega Man 2. The only thing that doesn't quite work out is the soundtrack not quite being as powerful as it could be.

But, overall, Aien Splatter Redux is a fantastic tite at a very e onomical price. I gleefully slammed over 2 hours into this one trying to make it through each level without dying, only stopping due to frustrations and the need to make dinner. If you miss the days of fun yet challenging titles like those mentioned above, just lay down the funds and add this to your library.

33880570.review:
This game captures the 8-bit style really well. A basic game even to 8-bit standards but quite enjoyable nonetheless. It's a run and gun side scroller without enemy pop-in.

Pros: Authentic 8-bit vibe, smooth gameplay, satisfying weapons, nice game flow and diverse levels.
Cons: 5 enemies being recycled for the entire game, short (~60 min), not challenging (including boss fights).

Pick this up if you are looking for some basic 8-bit nostalgia but look elsewhere if you want challenging gameplay.

33879003.review:
entertaining and feels complete. has some problems that might appeal to more a hardcore audience.

+mostly succesful NES style pixel art
+chiptunes and 90s vibe
+lots of variety in environment
-occasionally too chaotic and cheap baiting with enemies
-lessons learned early game don't properly prepare for the gameplay of later levels

comments/suggestions:
-break down the skills and resource management the player needs to learn better and make the bosses a better test of this
-mechanics and resource management is similar to batman, but it's not clearly explained. it's also confusing to have so many weapon pickups in the earlier levels that the game feels confused. there's challenges and tools provided, but no clear problem that needs a certain tool.
-bossfights of the first 4 levels could be much longer as they provide a welcome change.
-making the (later) levels so hard the player needs to memorise fully them feels dated design. it would work for the last level of the game but it felt too frustrating to keep going at times.
-pick ups seem often used to downgrade the player, it's used more as a challenged than a meaningful choice.

33865821.review:
Kind of fun, nostalgic looking, but quite easy. I hate games that are impossibly hard just to be hard, but this game is SO EASY. It looks like the developer based a lot of the graphic style on the Batman NES game. At certain points, I even felt like I was looking at a level area I remembered from the Batman NES game. The gameplay is not at all comparable to the Batman NES game. I don't think it's bad, it's just so easy and basic. The game was worth paying just under a dollar for it though.

One other thing, the dialogue is horrible. Either it was translated really badly into English, or this is a joke.
